revised_title: The Crounian Lectures on Muscular Motion: A Study of Animal Mechanics
tldr: The author presents a series of lectures on muscular motion, discussing the mechanics of animal muscles and the role of the nervous system in their function. The lectures cover the structure of muscular fibers, the interplay of interstitial air and nervous-muscular systems, and the circulation of blood in animal vessels. The author also considers the animal body as a machine with two interconnected systems, the lacteals, blood vessels, and lymphatics, and the nervous and muscular systems.
